title: Santa Fe National Historic Trail: Kaw Nation
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Exhibits     Kansas Exhibits     Kaw Nation                  Kaw Nation         Exhibit - We Lived Along the River NPS  The Kaw Nation once lived along the rivers in northeastern Kansas. The waterways were a key aspect of their daily life and culture. As more people headed west, either for trade or to settle, the Kanza were yet again forced to move, this time to Indian Territory, in present-day Oklahoma. We Lived Along the River, 1.2 MB pdf  Â      Exhibit - People of the Southwind NPS  The Kaw Nation faced land reduction and removal several times during the era of the Santa Fe Trail. This exhibit focuses on the survival of Kaw language and culture. People of the Southwind, 450 KB pdf
